intro: Psydrax amplifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf psidium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often consumed raw or used in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and agroforestry systems.
